data.title: Visit with Great Grandson
data.text: My wife and I took our 5 year old great grandson to the Children's Museum.  It is an outstanding place to take your young children. They have many things for the kids to do.  Too numerous to mention in this post. But the variety of attractions is great. Something for all to enjoy. There are three levels of attractions. Upper level, main level and lower level.  There are stairs but also an elevator.

owner_response.author: jaxelizabeth, Manager at Children's Museum of Eau Claire, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you so much for your kind words! We are so glad you enjoyed your visit with the great grandkiddo :)
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Granddaughters love it
data.text: Great place for children under 10 years old.  My granddaughters ask to go there and love it.  Rarely over crowded so they can easily play.

data.title: Great place on a Rainy or Cold day
data.text: I have visited the Children's Museum on multiple occasions and have never tired of going.  I'm pretty sure my husband and I had as much fun as the kids we brought.  We have taken grandchildren and friends children there. Hours have flown by with once looking at the clock wondering when we can leave.  Really recommend the Museum for a cold snowy day or rainy day.

data.title: Fun and interesting
data.text: All three of my kids love this place.  It is a total of three floors of fun.  They love the digestive system and the new upstairs area is wonderful!  They are always offering new things to participate in and they change activities often so you can always find something new and fun to do.  The water room is spectacular!  Arts and crafts are included in admission price and are always changing.  The kids have a blast every time we go.  They even have a little toddler area for tiny ones to safely play and explore.

data.title: Kids love it! Play and learn! What's better?
data.text: My kids have enjoyed coming here for years and they never get bored of it!  There are plenty of hands-on activities and play areas for kids to explore and learn.

data.title: Great day for the kiddos!
data.text: Had a great day!  Actually spent the whole day there.  Left for lunch and went back in the afternoon. So many things to do to keep the little one (2 1/2 years old) busy. The water play was the most fun but all the kids good at sharing. So many different stations the kids can voice from one to the next and never get bored.  Really good place to keep the kiddos busy.

data.title: Fun Time
data.text: My son really enjoys going here. There are lots of different areas to play in, especially since they added the second floor. There were a couple of things broken yesterday, but I know they are closing for a couple of weeks next month to update and repair so I'm sure these things will be fixed soon. $6 for all day which is very reasonable.

data.title: Love
data.text: Needed to kill time and ended up finding this place. 3 levels with a ton of room. Arts and crafts rooms, too! Kids didn't want to leave...spent a couple hours.

data.title: Rainy or Cold Day - Perfect Place for kids under 10
data.text: We bring our 2 and 4 year olds here a couple of times a year.  They do not change things around that often but that is understandable because their budget is tight.

data.title: Great fun and fun exhibits
data.text: I have brought many children into the museum, and everyone of them has had a great time. Everything from the water playroom, to the blocks, to learning about grocery stores and restaurants, and coloring. I will continue to bring all little ones in my care to the Childrens Museum.

owner_response.author: jaxelizabeth, Director of Programs at Children's Museum of Eau Claire, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hi Kathy! Thanks for the great feedback. We have lots of new exhibits and renovations happening over the next year, so we'll eagerly anticipate your thoughts!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Daycare for toddlers
data.text: Staff is rude and officious, will correct small things while toddlers dangle over railings and throw things.  Exhibits are entertaining for no more than 20 minutes and only for the under 5 crowd.  Save your money and go to a park.

owner_response.author: jaxelizabeth, Director of Programs at Children's Museum of Eau Claire, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hi Terri! Thanks for taking the time to let us know about your visit to the Museum. I'm so sorry that your encounter with our staff was unpleasant. Would you give us more information about the date and time of your visit? We'd like to look into the situation a bit further. You can e-mail me at jacqueline@cmec.cc. 

In regard to the Museum exhibits, almost all of our spaces are professionally fabricated and designed to be age appropriate for kids 0-10. That said, we like to let parents and caregivers determine whether or not their child would enjoy a visit--we have several 12 and 13 year olds who enjoy the spaces, too! And of course, we're always happy to give a free tour of the place to help you make a decision before you purchase a daily admission pass. 

We also agree that Eau Claire has a LOT of great parks and playgrounds! We recommend taking advantage of them whenever the weather allows :)
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Not for kids over 8
data.text: My son and I stopped by while we were in town and used our reciprocal membership from another museum.  The exhibits are nice but definitely geared toward quite young children.  At over 10 years old, this museum was definitely NOT for my kid.

owner_response.author: jaxelizabeth, Director of Programs at Children's Museum of Eau Claire, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hey there! Thanks for the feedback. We generally find that exhibits are geared towards kids 0-10, but know that every kid is at a different level. We are always happy to give our visitors a free tour of the Museum to help them make a decision before purchasing a daily admission pass.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Loyal Members
data.text: We have had a family membership at the Children's Museum of Eau Claire for nearly 5 years. It is well worth it for the activities, art projects and fun.  There is plenty to do for children of all ages - we bring our three children ages 4, 8 and 11 and they all find something to do.  Clean and well maintained with great, friendly staff.  Highly recommend.

owner_response.author: jaxelizabeth, Director of Programs at Children's Museum of Eau Claire, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks Rebecca! We love having you and your kids as members :)
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: We attended the Nano Science Night at our last visit, but have been there many times.
data.text: My kids love this museum!  Reasonably priced, fun activities, art projects, etc.  Parking downtown can be tricky, but there is a public lot right across the street.  Unfortunately, most parking is only 2 hour parking, so plan accordingly.

owner_response.author: jaxelizabeth, Director of Programs at Children's Museum of Eau Claire, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hi Jen! So glad you enjoyed the Nanoscience event. And thanks for the nice comments! As a heads up, we'll be hosting a free Building with Biology event on Thursday, September 29th from 5-7p. The same network that created the Nano kits have created these experiments, too! We're working with the University of Wisconsin-Eau Claire Biology Department to give kids a hands-on intro to synthetic biology and engineering. Hope to see you there!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: 101 Dalmatians
data.text:
Absolutely  refreshing! 
The kids did a great job and it was fun to see them enjoy entertaining us. You must visit the Children's Museum  & trust me, you'll be back.

owner_response.author: jaxelizabeth, Manager at Children's Museum of Eau Claire, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hi Rita!

Thanks so much for the kind review! I think, however, you were meaning to get a hold of the Eau Claire Children's Theatre. (We're the Children's Museum). They're the ones who put on the 101 Dalmations Show! We're good friends with them, so we'll pass your comments along if we see them!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: great place for a school field trip for younger children.
data.text: Something for every child. The children loved the grocery store and the stomach. Three floors of fun! Give yourself plenty of time to experience everything.

owner_response.author: jaxelizabeth, Director of Programs at Children's Museum of Eau Claire, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hey there! Thanks for the kind words. So glad you and your field trip group had fun (the stomach does seem to be a big hit). Hope to see you again!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: A lot of fun!
data.text: This is a super fun place for the kids!! It has many different levels with different activities on each floor. The city is fun, and the water works area is even more fun. It is great for a hot or rainy day.. I dont like that parents have to pay to attend, but the price is reasonable for the children to pay all day..

data.title: Fun and Inexpensive
data.text: I don't have kids but have came here several times when my friends and family visit. It's a cheap activity and the kids love it.

data.title: Kids Hands on Fun
data.text: A great place to bring kids for fun at learning, right in the downtown area, and not far from the logging camp at Carson park

data.title: Better than expected
data.text: This is a great place for young kids! Very interactive and educational. There's a little pretend city where kids can pretend to grocery shop or go to the bank. Lots of opportunities to get their hands-on learning!
